articles.description: Reaction as England reach the Women's World Cup final for the first time and Manchester City win Uefa Super Cup, plus Premier League news conferences.
articles.title: Lionesses reach World Cup final, Man City win Super Cup & transfer news

articles.description: We've been waiting for that performance from England, and Sarina Wiegman has brought everyone together, says record scorer Ellen White.
articles.title: 'England have momentum - now game of chess awaits'

articles.description: England captain Owen Farrell is once again a doubt for the start of the World Cup after World Rugby appealed a decision to overturn a red card received by the fly-half.
articles.title: Farrell ban could be reinstated as appeal launched

articles.description: England midfielder Keira Walsh says Ella Toone needs to be given more "respect" for helping the Lionesses reach the Women's World Cup final.
articles.title: England's Toone deserves more 'respect' - Walsh

articles.description: Commonwealth Games 10,000m champion Eilish McColgan pulls out of the World Athletics Championships starting on Saturday because of a knee injury.
articles.title: Injured McColgan to miss World Championships

articles.description: Watch highlights as goals from Ella Toone, Lauren Hemp and Alessia Russo help England book a place in their first Women's World Cup final by beating Australia 3-1.
articles.title: 'Incredible' England beat Australia to reach World Cup final

articles.description: Cole Palmer scored Manchester City's equaliser in the Uefa Super Cup against Sevilla to show he could yet become a key figure for Pep Guardiola, despite doubts about his future.
articles.title: 'Palmer could be next big star - but his Man City future is uncertain'

articles.description: The teenager. The prospect. The bolter. The late substitute. At Moscow 2013, an unfunded, unlikely quartet ended a 29-year wait for a British female sprint medal at a major championships.
articles.title: 'What the hell do we do?' - Moscow misfits who started an era

articles.description: Australia head coach Eddie Jones tells journalists to "give yourselves uppercuts" after his World Cup squad is questioned before their departure for France.
articles.title: 'Thanks for the worst press conference I've had'

articles.description: It started as a night full of optimism in Sydney, with thousands desperate to see Australia create Women's World Cup history - but England had other ideas.
articles.title: How England crashed Australia's party to reach final
